page.title: 17COOMBE FARM NR. BRIGHSTONE
page.content: This farm has 150 acres of which 80 acres are ploughed.The rest is used for grazing as it is either too steep for the tractor or else dry and of poor quality. Coombe farm is a mixed farm.Pigs are the chief concern, the farmer has 750 altogether which he breeds and fattens for slaughter in Newport. He also keeps some beef cattle. The main crop grown here is barley. This is then milled at the farm and fed to the pigs. Even this is not enough and more has to be bought in. Two other men help on the farm and the farmer's wife does office work and answers the telephone. The day starts at 7.00am with feeding time. The farmer said this was the worst job in winter as he often had to break the ice on their troughs and deal with frozen pipes.He loves farming usually.
